Package src.renderer

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
src.renderer.Camera
public class Camera extends Object
Camera object in 3d scene for creating rays through pixels.

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point point, Vector x, Vector z)
      Constructs a camera with p0, to and up vectors. The right vector is being calculated by the to and up vectors.
      Parameters:
      point - -> the camera p0
      x - -> The direction to where the camera is looking.
      z - -> The direction of the camera's upper direction.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When to and up vectors aren't orthogonal.

    • setVPSize

      public Camera setVPSize(double width, double height)
      Method for setting the view plane's size.
      Parameters:
      width - The new view plane's width.
      height - The new view plane's height.
      Returns:
      The camera itself. Builder design pattern.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When height/width illegal.

    • setVPDistance

      public Camera setVPDistance(double distance)
      Method for setting the distance between the camera and the view plane.
      Parameters:
      distance - The new distance between the camera and the view plane.
      Returns:
      The camera itself.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - When distance illegal. Builder design pattern.

    • constructOneRayPixel

      public Ray constructOneRayPixel(int X, int Y, int j, int i)
      Constructs a ray through a given pixel on the view plane.
      Parameters:
      X - Total number of pixels in the x dimension.
      Y - Total number of pixels in the y dimension.
      j - The index of the pixel on the x dimension.
      i - The index of the pixel on the y dimension.
      Returns:

    • setNumOfRays

      Parameters:
      numOfRays - The number of rays constructed.
      Returns:
      The camera itself.

    • constructRayPixelAA

      public LinkedList<Ray> constructRayPixelAA(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      Constructs a ray through a given pixel on the view plane for AA.
      Parameters:
      nX - Total number of pixels in the x dimension.
      nY - Total number of pixels in the y dimension.
      j - The index of the pixel on the x dimension.
      i - The index of the pixel on the y dimension.
      Returns:
      List of rays.

    • adaptive

      public void adaptive(int j1, int i1, int j2, int i2, int nX, int nY, int level)
      A function that improves the performance of the renderer, by dividing the grid into parts for parts with no objects, reduces the amount of rays.
      Parameters:
      nX - the number of columns in the picture
      nY - the number of rows in the picture
      level - Grid level of division

    • setMultithreading

      public void setMultithreading(int threads)
      Chaining method for setting number of threads. If set to 1, the render won't use the thread pool. If set to greater than 1, the render will use the thread pool with the given threads. If set to 0, the thread pool will pick the number of threads.
      Parameters:
      threads - number of threads to use
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when threads is less than 0

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(int interval, Color color)
      Adds a grid to the image.
      Parameters:
      interval - num of the grid's lines
      color - the color of the grid's lines
